bill_title: assign responsibility for costs of prosecution and defense of inmates who commit crimes while under the control of the Department of Corrections.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assign responsibility for costs of prosecution and defense of inmates who commit crimes while under the control of the Department of Corrections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 1-15 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any inmate, as defined in § 1-15-20.1, commits a criminal offense while confined in any prison, facility, or program under the control of the Department of Corrections pursuant to § 1- 15.1.4, the attorney general shall pay all costs for prosecution of the individual. The Department of Corrections shall pay all costs for defense of the individual, including costs for hearings, transcripts, appointed counsel, expert witnesses, and staff, from funds appropriated to the Department of Corrections. The court may order the defendant to reimburse the Department of Corrections for such costs. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
